title: Dinamicka alokacija nizova
description: PCEX Set of activities for Dinamicka alokacija nizova
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_niza_calloc
description: Napisati program koji koristi dinamičku alokaciju memorije za cjelobrojni niz. Program treba imati posebnu funkciju za alokaciju niza i posebnu funkciju za oslobađanje zauzete memorije. Korisnik unosi broj elemenata niza, zatim unosi vrijednosti elemenata. Nakon unosa, program treba ispisati elemente niza u obrnutom redoslijedu. Na kraju programa obavezno pravilno osloboditi dinamički alociranu memoriju.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_niza_malloc
description: Napisati program koji koristi dinamičku alokaciju memorije za cjelobrojni niz. Program treba imati posebnu funkciju za alokaciju niza i posebnu funkciju za oslobađanje zauzete memorije. Korisnik unosi broj elemenata niza, zatim unosi vrijednosti elemenata. Nakon unosa, program treba ispisati elemente niza u obrnutom redoslijedu. Na kraju programa obavezno pravilno osloboditi dinamički alociranu memoriju.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_nizova_challenge
description: Napisati program koji koristi dinamičku alokaciju memorije koja je inicijalizirana s nulama za niz struktura. Definisati strukturu Student koja sadrži ime studenta i broj bodova. Program treba imati posebnu funkciju za alokaciju niza studenata i posebnu funkciju za oslobađanje memorije. Korisnik unosi broj studenata, zatim podatke za svakog studenta. Nakon unosa, program treba pronaći i ispisati podatke o studentu koji ima najveći broj bodova. Na kraju programa obavezno pravilno osloboditi dinamički alociranu memoriju.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Dinamicka alokacija obicnih varijabli
description: PCEX Set of activities for Dinamicka alokacija obicnih varijabli
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_varijable_calloc
description: Napisati program koji dinamički alocira memoriju za jednu realnu varijablu. Program treba omogućiti korisniku unos realnog broja sa tastature, zatim umanjiti unesenu vrijednost za 1 i ispisati dobijeni rezultat na ekran. Program mora provjeriti da li je alokacija memorije uspješna i na kraju pravilno osloboditi zauzetu memoriju korištenjem funkcije free.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_varijable_malloc
description: Napisati C program koji dinamički alocira memoriju za jednu cjelobrojnu varijablu. Program treba omogućiti korisniku da unese cijeli broj, smjesti ga u dinamički alociranu memoriju, ispiše unesenu vrijednost na ekran, te na kraju pravilno oslobodi zauzetu memoriju. Potrebno je provjeriti da li je alokacija memorije uspješno izvršena prije korištenja pokazivača.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_dinamicka_alokacija_varijabli_challenge
description:
Napisati program koji od korisnika traži unos broja elemenata n, a zatim u petlji dinamički alocira memoriju za jednu cijelobrojnu varijablu pri svakom unosu. Program treba omogućiti korisniku da unese 
n cijelih brojeva, sabere njihove vrijednosti i na kraju ispiše ukupan zbir. Nakon svake upotrebe, dinamički alocirana memorija mora biti pravilno oslobođena, uz obaveznu provjeru uspješnosti alokacije.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Funkcije i strukture s pokazivacima
description: PCEX Set of activities for Funkcije i strukture s pokazivacima
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_s_pokazivacima
description: Napisati program u kojem se definišu strukture Tacka i Kruznica. Program treba omoguciti unos obje strukture i ispisati da li je unešena tačka unutar kružnice. Kreirati pomoćnu funkciju koja računa udaljenost između dvije tačke te koristiti pokazivače u implementaciji.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_funkcije_sredina_tacaka_s_pokazivacima
description: Napisati program koji definiše strukturu Tacka te fukciju "sredina" koja prima dvije varijable tipa ove strukture, računa središnju tačku te je vraća iz funkcije.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_funkcija_pravougaonik_pokazivaci
description: Napisati funkciju povecaj_pravougaonik koja prima pokazivač na strukturu Pravougaonik. Ova struktura sadrži polja "sirina" i "visina".  Funkcija ne vraća ništa, te povećava širinu pravougaonika za 1.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Funkcije i strukture
description: PCEX Set of activities for Funkcije i strukture
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_funkcije_sredina_tacaka
description: Napisati program koji definiše strukturu Tacka te fukciju "sredina" koja prima dvije varijable tipa ove strukture, računa središnju tačku te je vraća iz funkcije.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_funkcija_pravougaonik
description: Napisati funkciju povecaj_pravougaonik koja prima strukturu Pravougaonik. Ova struktura sadrži polja "sirina" i "visina".  Funkcija vraća strukturu pravougaonik te povećava širinu pravougaonika za 1.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Unos i ispis struktura
description: PCEX Set of activities for Unos i ispis struktura
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture
description: Napisati program u kojem se definišu strukture Tacka i Kruznica. Program treba omoguciti unos obje strukture i ispisati da li je unešena tačka unutar kružnice. Kreirati pomoćnu funkciju koja računa udaljenost između dvije tačke.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_unos_i_ispis_datuma
description: Napisati kod koji kreira strukturu datum te funkcije za unos i ispis datuma.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_unos_i_ispis_proizvoda
description: Napisati kod koji koristi strukturu Datum i Proizvod, pri čemu Proizvod sadrži  polja: naziv, cijena, datum proizvodnje i isteka te predstavlja neki proizvod koji se skladišti/prodaje u supermarketu.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_unos_ispis_studenta_challenge
description: Napisati program koji koristi strukturu Student (s poljima ime, indeks i prosjek) te dvije funkcije - jedna za unos, a druga za ispis studenta.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Nizovi u strukturama i nizovi struktura
description: PCEX Set of activities for Nizovi u strukturama i nizovi struktura
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_i_nizovi
description: Napisati program u programskom jeziku C koji omogućava rad sa studentima koristeći strukture i nizove. Potrebno je definisati strukturu Student koja sadrži ime i prezime studenta, broj indeksa, niz od pet ocjena i prosjek ocjena. Program treba omogućiti unos podataka za tri studenta, pri čemu se za svakog studenta unose lični podaci i ocjene. Nakon unosa, potrebno je izračunati prosjek ocjena za svakog studenta korištenjem posebne funkcije. Zatim je potrebno sortirati niz studenata po prosjeku ocjena u rastućem redoslijedu koristeći selection sort algoritam i na kraju ispisati podatke o studentima nakon sortiranja.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_i_nizovi_pokazivaci
description: Napisati program koji omogućava rad sa studentima koristeći strukture i nizove. Potrebno je definisati strukturu Student koja sadrži ime i prezime studenta, broj indeksa, niz od pet ocjena i prosjek ocjena. Program treba omogućiti unos podataka za tri studenta, pri čemu se za svakog studenta unose lični podaci i ocjene. Nakon unosa, potrebno je izračunati prosjek ocjena za svakog studenta korištenjem posebne funkcije. Zatim je potrebno sortirati niz studenata po prosjeku ocjena u rastućem redoslijedu koristeći selection sort algoritam i na kraju ispisati podatke o studentima nakon sortiranja. Koristiti pokazivačku aritmetiku.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_strukture_i_nizovi_challenge
description: Napisati program u programskom jeziku C koji radi sa strukturom `Proizvod` koja sadrži naziv proizvoda i njegovu cijenu. U programu je dat niz od nekoliko proizvoda. Potrebno je implementirati funkciju koja sortira niz proizvoda po cijeni u rastućem redoslijedu koristeći selection sort algoritam. Prilikom sortiranja obavezno je koristiti pokazivač na niz struktura i pokazivačku aritmetiku za pristup elementima niza. Nakon sortiranja potrebno je ispisati proizvode redom, sa njihovim nazivom i cijenom.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Append i read-update mod za binarne datoteke
description: PCEX Set of activities for Append i read-update mod za binarne datoteke
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_izmjena_binarnih_datoteka
description: Napisati program koji omogućava dodavanje novih zapisa u binarnu datoteku brojevi.dat. Definisati strukturu Broj koja sadrži jedan cijeli broj. Program treba otvoriti binarnu datoteku u režimu za dodavanje (ab), omogućiti korisniku unos jednog cijelog broja sa tastature i upisati uneseni podatak u datoteku korištenjem funkcije fwrite. Prilikom svakog pokretanja programa novi zapis treba biti dodan na kraj postojeće datoteke, bez brisanja ranije upisanih podataka. U slučaju da se datoteka ne može otvoriti, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_izmjena_binarnih_datoteka_challenge
description: Napisati program koji radi s binarnom datotekom poruke.dat. Datoteka sadrži jednu kratku tekstualnu poruku fiksne dužine (niz znakova) od maksimalno 50 znakova. Program treba otvoriti datoteku u update režimu, pomjeriti kursor na početak datoteke pomoću funkcije fseek i zamijeniti postojeću poruku novom porukom unesenom sa tastature, koristeći funkciju fwrite. Nakon uspješnog upisa program treba zatvoriti datoteku i ispisati poruku o uspješnom ažuriranju. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Rad s kursorom u tekstualnim datotekama
description: PCEX Set of activities for Rad s kursorom u tekstualnim datotekama
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_izmjena_datoteka_koristenjem_kursora
description: Napisati program koji radi sa tekstualnom datotekom podaci.txt otvorenom u read-update režimu. Program treba prvo otvoriti datoteku i pomoću funkcije fseek pomjeriti kursor na kraj datoteke, a zatim pomoću funkcije ftell odrediti i ispisati trenutnu poziciju kursora (veličinu datoteke). Nakon toga program treba pomjeriti kursor na početak datoteke korištenjem fseek sa parametrom SEEK_SET i ispisati prvih nekoliko znakova iz datoteke. Na kraju, program treba ponovo ispisati trenutnu poziciju kursora koristeći ftell i zatvoriti datoteku. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanja_izmjena_koristenjem_kursora_challenge
description: Napisati program koji otvara tekstualnu datoteku podaci.txt u update režimu. Program treba pomoću funkcije fseek postaviti kursor na sredinu datoteke, a zatim od te pozicije pročitati i ispisati naredna tri znaka na ekran. Prije čitanja, program treba koristiti funkciju ftell kako bi odredio i ispisao poziciju kursora na sredini datoteke. Nakon čitanja tri znaka, potrebno je ponovo ispisati trenutnu poziciju kursora pomoću funkcije ftell. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Pisanje u binarne datoteke
description: PCEX Set of activities for Pisanje u binarne datoteke
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_pisanje_u_binarne_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji omogućava upis podataka o osobama u binarnu datoteku baza.dat. Definisati strukturu Osoba koja sadrži ime osobe i broj godina. Implementirati funkciju zapisi koja prima niz struktura Osoba i broj elemenata u tom nizu, te podatke upisuje u binarnu datoteku korištenjem funkcije fwrite. U glavnom programu potrebno je formirati niz od nekoliko osoba, pozvati funkciju zapisi i ispisati poruku o uspješnom upisu podataka. Ukoliko dođe do greške prilikom otvaranja ili pisanja u datoteku, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_pisanje_podatka_u_binarnu_datoteku
description: Napisati program u programskom jeziku C koji u binarnu datoteku podatak.dat upisuje jedan podatak tipa double. Program treba otvoriti datoteku u binarnom režimu za pisanje, upisati vrijednost realnog broja korištenjem funkcije fwrite i zatvoriti datoteku. Ukoliko nije moguće otvoriti datoteku, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_pisanje_u_binarne_datoteke_challenge
description: Napisati program koji omogućava upis podataka o kursevima u binarnu datoteku kurs.dat. Definisati strukturu Kurs koja sadrži naziv kursa, šifru kursa i broj ECTS bodova. Program treba omogućiti korisniku unos proizvoljnog broja kurseva sa tastature, a zatim unesene podatke upisati u binarnu datoteku korištenjem funkcije fwrite. Datoteku je potrebno otvoriti u binarnom režimu za pisanje tako da se prilikom pokretanja programa kreira nova datoteka ili se postojeća briše. Nakon uspješnog upisa podataka program treba zatvoriti datoteku i ispisati poruku o uspješnom kreiranju binarne datoteke. U slučaju greške pri otvaranju ili pisanju u datoteku, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Unos struktura u tekstualne datoteke
description: PCEX Set of activities for Unos struktura u tekstualne datoteke
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_pisanje_u_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji iz tekstualne datoteke ispit.txt učitava podatke o studentima. Datoteka sadrži zapise u kojima su za svakog studenta navedeni prezime, ime i broj osvojenih bodova. Program treba učitati sve zapise u niz struktura Student, sortirati studente po broju bodova u opadajućem redoslijedu, te sortirane podatke upisati u novu tekstualnu datoteku ispit_sortiran.txt. Ukoliko nije moguće otvoriti neku od datoteka, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_pisanje_u_datoteke_challenge
description: Napisati program koji omogućava unos podataka o knjigama i njihov upis u tekstualnu datoteku knjige.txt. Definisati strukturu Knjiga koja sadrži naziv knjige, ime autora i godinu izdanja. Program treba otvoriti datoteku u režimu za pisanje tako da se prilikom pokretanja kreira nova datoteka ili se postojeća datoteka briše. Nakon toga je potrebno omogućiti korisniku unos proizvoljnog broja knjiga sa tastature i upisati unesene podatke u datoteku koristeći funkciju fprintf, pri čemu se svaki zapis upisuje u poseban red u formatu: naziv autor godina. Nakon završetka unosa program treba zatvoriti datoteku i ispisati poruku o uspješnom kreiranju datoteke. Ukoliko dođe do greške pri otvaranju datoteke, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Citanje iz binarnih datoteka
description: PCEX Set of activities for Citanje iz binarnih datoteka
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_iz_bin_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji omogućava čitanje podataka o osobama iz binarne datoteke baza.dat. Datoteka sadrži zapise tipa Osoba, pri čemu svaki zapis obuhvata ime osobe i broj godina. Potrebno je definisati strukturu Osoba i funkciju ucitaj koja prima pokazivač na niz struktura i iz binarne datoteke učitava maksimalno 100 zapisa korištenjem funkcije fread. Funkcija treba vratiti broj uspješno učitanih zapisa. U glavnom programu potrebno je pozvati funkciju ucitaj, a zatim ispisati ukupan broj učitanih osoba i tabelarni prikaz njihovih imena i godina. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti ili u njoj nema zapisa, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_podatka_iz_bin_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji iz binarne datoteke broj.dat učitava jedan podatak tipa double. Program treba otvoriti datoteku u binarnom režimu za čitanje, pomoću funkcije fread učitati jednu realnu vrijednost i ispisati je na ekran sa dvije decimale. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_iz_bin_datoteke_challenge
description: Napisati program koji čita podatke iz binarne datoteke proizvodi.dat. Datoteka sadrži zapise tipa Proizvod, pri čemu svaki zapis obuhvata naziv proizvoda, šifru proizvoda i njegovu cijenu. Program treba otvoriti binarnu datoteku za čitanje, učitati sve zapise pomoću funkcije fread, te odrediti ukupan broj proizvoda u datoteci i pronaći proizvod sa najvećom cijenom. Nakon obrade podataka potrebno je ispisati ukupan broj proizvoda, kao i naziv, šifru i cijenu najskupljeg proizvoda. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti ili ako je datoteka prazna, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Citanje struktura iz tekstualnih datoteka
description: PCEX Set of activities for Citanje struktura iz tekstualnih datoteka
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_struktura_iz_datoteka
description: Napisati program koji iz tekstualne datoteke ispit.txt učitava podatke o studentima. Datoteka sadrži više redova, pri čemu svaki red ima sljedeći format: prezime studenta, ime studenta i broj bodova, razdvojene razmakom. Program treba otvoriti datoteku za čitanje, učitati zapise u niz struktura `Student` (maksimalno 300 zapisa), te nakon uspješnog učitavanja ispisati ukupan broj učitanih studenata i tabelarni prikaz njihovih podataka. Ukoliko datoteku nije moguće otvoriti, ili ako je datoteka prazna odnosno neispravno formatirana, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku.
author: Amina Hromic

title: c_citanje_iz_txt_challenge
description: Napisati program koji čita podatke iz tekstualne datoteke rezultati.txt. Datoteka sadrži više redova, pri čemu je svaki red zapisan u sljedećem formatu: prezime studenta, ime studenta i broj bodova, razdvojeni razmacima. Program treba učitati sve zapise iz datoteke i na osnovu učitanih podataka ispisati ukupan broj studenata, broj studenata koji su položili ispit (studenti sa 40 ili više bodova), te podatke o studentu koji ima najveći broj bodova (prezime, ime i broj bodova). Ukoliko datoteka ne postoji ili je prazna, program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku o grešci.
author: Amina Hromic

title: Izmjena tekstualnih datoteka
description: PCEX Set of activities for Izmjena tekstualnih datoteka
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_upis_broja_karaktera_na_kraj_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji broji koliko ima karaktera u datoteci datoteka.txt i zatim na njen kraj upisuje tekst “\nBroj karaktera: “ nakon kojeg slijedi tačan broj izbrojanih karaktera.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_upis_na_kraj_datoteke
description: Napisati program koji otvara datoteku datoteka.txt i na njen kraj upisuje tekst “--KRAJ--”.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_upis_reda_na_kraj_datoteke
description: Data je datoteka knjige.txt koja u svakom redu sadrži sljedeće podatke razdvojene zarezom: cijena (realan broj), broj primjeraka (cijeli broj) i naziv (string). Napisati program koji dodaje novu knjigu u datoteku.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Makro naredbe
description: PCEX Set of activities for Makro naredbe
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_makro_kvadrat_broja
description: Napisati program koji računa kvadrat cijelog broja pomoću makro naredbi i ispisuje kvadrat broja 5 na standardni izlaz.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_makro_max_broj
description: Napisati program koji ispisuje veći od dva data cijela broja pomoću makro naredbi.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Upis u formatirane tekstualne datoteke
description: PCEX Set of activities for Upis u formatirane tekstualne datoteke
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_formatirane_datoteke_upis_broja_i_stringa
description: U programu su data imena studenata. Potrebno je kreirati novu datoteku studenti.txt i u nju upisati za svakog studenta njegov redni broj kao ID i ime studenta, na primjer: ID: 0, Ime: Sanja.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_formatirane_datoteke_upis_sa_decimalama
description: U programu su data imena studenata i njihovi bodovi. Potrebno je kreirati novu datoteku studenti.txt i u nju upisati za svakog studenta njegov broj bodova zaokružen na dvije decimale i ime studenta. Razdvojiti vrijednosti kao u sljedećem primjeru: Bodovi: 12.98; Ime: Ana.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Citanje sadrzaja formatiranih tekstualnih datoteka
description: PCEX Set of activities for Citanje sadrzaja formatiranih tekstualnih datoteka
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_formatirane_datoteke_citanje_broja_i_stringa
description: Neka svaki red u datoteci datoteka.txt sadrži jedan broj i jedan string, razdvojeni razmakom. Napisati program koji će ispisati na ekran sve stringove jedan ispod drugog i sumu svih brojeva koji se nalaze u datoteci.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_formatirane_datoteke_citanje_brojeva_i_stringa
description: Data je datoteka knjige.txt koja u svakom redu sadrži sljedeće podatke razdvojene zarezom: cijena (realan broj), broj primjeraka (cijeli broj) i naziv (string). Napisati program koji računa i ispisuje na ekran ukupnu vrijednost spašenih knjiga (zbir proizvoda cijene i broja primjeraka svake knjige).

title: Queue Class - Check if Element Exists
description: In this example, you will use Queue class from queue provided by python. This class contains methods for adding a new element to the end and retrieving the first element of the queue. However it does not contain a method to check if the queue contains an element. We will define a function that will traverse the queue and return True if the queue contains the given element.
author: Aditya Joshi

title: Queue Class - Check if Element Exists
description: In this example, you will use Queue class from queue provided by python. This class contains methods for adding a new element to the end and retrieving the first element of the queue. However it does not contain a method to check if the queue contains an element. We will define a function that will traverse the queue and return True if the queue contains the given element.
author: Aditya Joshi

title: c_funkcija_podstring
description: Napisati funkciju podstring koja prima dva stringa s1 i s2, te provjerava da li je s2 podstring stringa s1. Ako jeste, funkcija treba vratiti pokazivač na prvi znak u stringu s1 koji predstavlja početak podstringa, u suprotnom treba vratiti nul-pokazivač.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_funkcija_ukloni_razmake
description: Napisati funkciju ukloni_razmake koja prima string i uklanja sve razmake u njemu. Funcija treba vratiti pokazivač na početak izmijenjenog stringa.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Slanje stringova u funkcije
description: PCEX Set of activities for Slanje stringova u funkcije

title: c_funkcija_uporedi_stringove
description: Napisati funkciju koja daje poredak dva stringa po leksikografskom redoslijedu, te vraća -1 ako je prvi string manji od drugog, +1 ako je prvi string veći od drugog, a 0 ako su jednaki.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_funkcija_prebroji_znak
description: Implementirati funkciju prebroji koja prima string i karakter, te vraća broj pojavljivanja tog karaktera u stringu. U glavnom programu omogućiti unos stringa i ispis broja pronađenih pojavljivanja.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_funkcija_nadji_rijec
description: Napisati funkciju nadji_rijec koja prima dva stringa s1 i s2, pri čemu s1 predstavlja neku rečenicu, a s2 jednu riječ. Funkcija treba vratiti logičku istinu (1) ako se riječ nalazi u rečenici, a neistinu ako se ne nalazi.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Ubacivanje karaktera u string

author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_ubacivanje_rijeci
description: Napisati program koji u datom stringu zamjenjuje svaku cifru 1 sa tekstom "jedan". Pretpostaviti da je primljeni string dovoljno velik da primi sve dodatne karaktere.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_spajanje_dva_stringa
description: Napisati program koji dodaje sadržaj drugog stringa prvom stringu.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Brisanje dijelova stringa

author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_izbacivanje_svakog_ntog_karaktera
description: Napisati program u kojem se iz datog stringa izbacuje svaki n-ti karakter. Brojanje karaktera počinje od 1 (prvi karakter se briše ako je n=1).
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_izbacivanje_nte_rijeci
description: Napisati program koji iz datog stringa izbacuje n-tu riječ po redu. Brojanje počinje od 1 (prva riječ se treba obrisati ako je n = 1). Riječ je niz karaktera omeđena razmacima.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_brisanje_samoglasnika

title: c_pretvaranje_broja_u_slovo
description: Napisati program koji omogućava unos teksta sa maksimalno 1000 karaktera, a zatim u tekstu zamjenjuje sve brojeve sa slovom 'B'. Ispisati izmijenjeni string na kraju programa.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_zamjena_svakog_drugog_znaka
description: Napisati program u kojem se u unešenom stringu zamijeni svaki drugi znak znakom '*'. Kandidati za zamjenu su znakovi koji nisu razmak ili neki od interpunkcijskih znakova ',.;:!?-'. Program na kraju treba ispisati izmijenjeni string.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Detektovanje granica unutar stringa
description: PCEX Set of activities for Detektovanje granica unutar stringa
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_brojanje_rijeci_alfanumericki
description: Napisati program u kojem se omogućava unos nekog stringa, a zatim se ispisuje broj riječi koje se u njemu nalaze. Riječ je definisana kao niz uzastopnih alfanumeričkih karaktera. Sve što nije alfanumerički znak (zarezi, tačke, razmaci) se smatraju razdvajačima riječi.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_brojanje_rijeci_razmaci
description: Napisati program u kojem se omogućava unos nekog stringa s najviše 1000 karaktera, a zatim se ispisuje broj riječi koje se u njemu nalaze. Riječ je definisana kao niz karaktera omeđen razmacima, oznakom početka ili kraja stringa.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_brojanje_rijeci_s_velikim_pocetnim_slovom
description: Napisati program u kojem se omogućava unos nekog stringa, a zatim se ispisuje broj njegovih riječi koje počinju velikim slovom. Riječ je definisana kao niz karaktera omeđen razmacima, oznakom početka ili kraja stringa.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Pokazivaci na karaktere

title: c_pokazivaci_na_karaktere_brojanje_samoglasnika
description: Napisati program koji prolazi kroz niz karaktera koristeći pokazivačku aritmetiku i broji koliko se puta pojavljuju samoglasnici. Program treba prepoznati i mala i velika slova. Na kraju ispisati ukupan broj samoglasnika.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_trazenje_karaktera_u_stringu_pokazivaci

description: Napisati program koji prolazi kroz niz karaktera i broji koliko se puta u njemu pojavljuju samoglasnici. Program treba prepoznati i mala i velika slova. Na kraju ispisati ukupan broj samoglasnika.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_unos_niza_karaktera
description: Napisati program koji od korisnika traži da unese broj indeksa (cijeli broj), ime i prezime. Nizovi za ime i prezime mogu imati najviše 20 karaktera.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_trazenje_karaktera_u_stringu
description: Napisati program koji provjerava da li se u datom stringu nalazi određeni karakter.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_unos_karaktera_getchar
description: Napisati program koji traži od korisnika da unese jedan karakter, koji se čita pomoću getchar() funkcije. Program treba zatim ispisati da li je znak veliko slovo, malo slovo ili nešto drugo.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_unos_karaktera_za_karakterom
description: Napisati program koji traži da tri studenta (Tarik, Bojan i Mirza) unesu sa standardnog ulaza po jedno slovo koje predstavlja njihovo odabrano jelo. Na kraju ispisati šta je svako izabrao.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_unos_broja_i_karaktera
description: Napisati program u kojem se traži unos broja nekog stola (prirodan broj), a nakon toga jedno malo slovo koje označava boju stola. Boja može imati neku od vrijednosti: ‘c’, ‘p’ ili ‘z’. Program treba ispisati odgovarajuću poruku ako unos korisnika nije validan ili ispisati koja je boja odabrana za sto.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Pokazivacka aritmetika
description: PCEX Set of activities for Pokazivacka aritmetika
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_pokazivaci_manipulacija_clanova_niza
description: Dat je niz cijelih brojeva i pokazivač p koji pokazuje na drugi član niza. Uvećati vrijednost drugog člana niza za 1 preko pokazivača p i ispisati je. Zatim izračunati i postaviti novu vrijednost pretposljednjeg elementa niza tako što se njegova prethodna vrijednost pomnoži sa 2, te i tu novu vrijednost ispisati.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_pokazivaci_pomjeranje_kroz_niz
description: Dat je niz cijelih brojeva i pokazivač p koji pokazuje na prvi član niza. Program treba ispisati vrijednost prvog i drugog člana niza koristeći samo pokazivač p (pokazivačku aritmetiku). Zatim pomjeriti pokazivač da pokazuje na posljednji član i ispisati taj član, a nakon toga vratiti p za jedno mjesto unazad i ispisati pretposljednji član niza.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_pokazivaci_pomjeranje_kroz_niz_i_manipulacija
description: Napisati program u kojem je inicijalizovan niz sa 10 cjelobrojnih vrijednosti i pokazivač na prvi element niza. Vrijednost prvog elementa treba iskoristiti kao broj pozicija za pomjeranje pokazivača unutar niza. Ako je pomjeranje moguće (ne izlazi izvan granica niza), program treba pomjeriti pokazivač unaprijed za toliko mjesta i ispisati vrijednost elementa na koji pokazivač dospije, uvećanu za 5. Ako pomjeranje izlazi izvan niza, ispisati poruku o grešci.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Dereferenciranje pokazivaca
description: PCEX Set of activities for Dereferenciranje pokazivaca
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_promjena_vrijednosti_preko_pokazivaca
description: U programu je deklarisan realan broj x i pokazivač double *p. Postavite p da pokazuje na x, promijenite vrijednost x preko p na 0.9 i ispišite x, p i vrijednost na koju pokazuje p.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_pokazivaci_dereferenciranje_int
description: Napisati program koji deklariše cjelobrojnu varijablu i dodjeljuje njenu adresu odgovarajućem pokazivaču p. Zatim ispisati adresu varijable a i vrijednosti pohranjene u a, p i na adresi na koju pokazuje p.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_promjena_vrijednosti_preko_pokazivaca_2
description: U programu su date cjelobrojne varijable a i b. Pokazivač p prvobitno pokazuje na varijablu a. Vaš zadatak je da promijenite vrijednost varijable b na 10 koristeći pokazivač p. Program ispisuje vrijednosti spremljene u a i b prije i poslije promjene.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_vrijednosti_u_pokazivacima
description: Napisati program koji deklariše dvije varijable tipa long int i double, i dodjeljuje njihove adrese u odgovarajuće pokazivače. Zatim ispisati adrese tih varijabli i vrijednosti pohranjene u pokazivačima.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_vrijednosti_u_pokazivacima_int
description: Napisati program u kojem se deklarišu dvije cjelobrojne varijable i dva pokazivača na int. Postaviti pokazivač p da pokazuje na varijablu a, a pokazivač q da pokazuje na varijablu b. Zatim ispisati adrese varijabli a i b, te vrijednosti pohranjene u pokazivačima p i q.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_pokazivaci_min_max
description: Napisati program koji implementira i poziva funkciju min_max. Funkcija prima dva cijela broja i pomoću pokazivača sprema u zadane varijable: manju vrijednost (min) i veću vrijednost (max). U glavnom programu deklarisati dvije cijele vrijednosti i varijable za rezultat, pozvati funkciju i ispisati dobijene vrijednosti.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: Zamjena redova i kolona
description: PCEX Set of activities for Zamjena redova i kolona
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_zamjena_dvije_kolone
description: Napisati program koji zamjenjuje dvije kolone matrice (elementi jedne kolone postaju elementi druge kolone, i obrnuto). Korisnik unosi indekse dvije kolone koje želi zamijeniti.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_zamjena_dva_reda
description: Napisati program koji zamjenjuje dva reda matrice (elementi jednog reda postaju elementi drugog reda, i obrnuto). Korisnik unosi indekse dva reda koja želi zamijeniti.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_zamjena_redova
description: Napisati program koji zamjenjuje redove matrice (elementi jednog reda postaju elementi drugog reda, i obrnuto). Korisnik unosi indekse redova koje želi zamijeniti. Na primjer, unos 1 2 3 4 označava da se redovi sa indeksima 1 i 2 trebaju zamijeniti, kao i redovi s indeksima 3 i 4.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_zamjena_kolona_dva_mjesta_dalje
description: Napisati program koji pomjera svaku kolonu matrice na mjesto kolone koja se nalazi dva mjesta desno od nje. Brojanje kolona ide u krug: ako matrica ima 5 kolona, kolona s indeksom 0 dolazi na mjesto kolone 2, kolona 1 na kolonu 3, kolona 3 na kolonu 0 itd. Korisnik unosi elemente matrice dimenzija 4x5, a program ispisuje novu matricu nakon jednog prolaska zamjene svih kolona. Napomena: Preporučuje se koristiti privremenu kopiju matrice kako bi se izbjeglo prepisivanje vrijednosti dok se mijenjaju kolone.
author: Mubina Kamberovic

title: c_funkcija_djeljiv_sa_3
description: Napisati funkciju int djeljivSaTri(int x) koja vraća 1 ako je broj x djeljiv sa 3, a 0 ako broj x nije djeljiv sa 3. U glavnom programu koristiti tu funkciju da se ispišu svi brojevi od 10 do 50 koji su djeljivi sa 3.

Prvi broj treba ukupno zauzeti barem 4 mjesta prilikom ispisa, a drugi barem 8 mjesta.

title: Reporting the Total Hours Each Employee Worked (Case 1)
description:
Suppose we have an input file that contains information about how many hours each employee of a company has worked. The file looks like the following (Employee's name, Hours):
Erica 7.5 8.5 10.25 8 8.5
Erin 10.5 11.5 12 11 10.75
Simone 8 8 8
...
Construct a program that reads this file and calculates the total number of hours worked by each individual. Make sure that the program handles each specific exception that could occur.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Reporting the Total Hours Each Employee Worked (Case 2)
description:
Suppose we have an input file that contains information about how many hours each employee of a company has worked. The file looks like the following (Employee's identification number, Employee's name, Hours):
101 Erica 7.5 8.5 10.25 8 8.5
783 Erin 10.5 11.5 12 11 10.75
114 Simone 8 8 8
...
Construct a program that reads this file and calculates the total number of hours worked by each individual. Make sure that the program handles each specific exception that could occur.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Determining the Maximum Rating for Each Soda in The Survey
description: Suppose a soda manufacturer held a taste test for four new flavors to determine if people liked them. The manufacturer got 10 people to try each new flavor and give it a score from 1 to 5, where 1 equals poor and 5 equals excellent. The results of that survey is stored in a matrix. Each row of the matrix holds the responses that all testers gave for one particular soda flavor, and each column holds the responses of one person for all sodas.\nConstruct a program that determines the maximum rating that each of the four new flavors of soda received.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Determining the Average Rating for Each Soda in The Survey
description: Suppose a soda manufacturer held a taste test for four new flavors to determine if people liked them. The manufacturer got 10 people to try each new flavor and give it a score from 1 to 5, where 1 equals poor and 5 equals excellent. The results of that survey is stored in a matrix. Each row of the matrix holds the responses that all testers gave for one particular soda flavor, and each column holds the responses of one person for all sodas.\nConstruct a program that determines the average ratings that respondents provided to four new flavors of soda.

The manufacturer got 10 people to try each new flavor and give it a score from 1 to 5, where 1 equals poor and 5 equals excellent. The results of that survey is stored in a matrix. Each row of the matrix holds the responses that all testers gave for one particular soda flavor, and each column holds the responses of one person for all sodas.\nConstruct a program that determines the average ratings that respondents provided to four new flavors of soda as well as the average ratings of each respondent.

title: arithmetic.bmi_calculator
description: PCEX Set of activities for arithmetic.bmi_calculator
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating Body Mass Index (BMI)
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows:
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
Construct a program that calculates the Body Mass Index (BMI) according to this formula.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating and Rounding Up Body Mass Index (BMI) To the Nearest Integer
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows: 
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
 BMI results are usually displayed as integers (values without decimal points). Construct a program to round the BMI result to the nearest integer.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: arrays.j_array_rotate
description: PCEX Set of activities for arrays.j_array_rotate
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Left by One Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the left by 1 position so that the value at the front of the array goes to the back and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Left by Two Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the left by 2 position so that the value at the front of the array goes to the second last position, the second value of the array goes to the back, and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Right by One Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the right by one position so that the value that is currently at the end of the array is moved to the front, shifting the remaining values to the right. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {6, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Right by Two Position
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the right by 2 position so that the value that is currently at the end of the list is moved to the second position, the second last value of the list is moved to the front of the list, and the remaining values are shifted to the right. For example, if the list is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 4}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Finding Adjacent Consecutive Numbers in a Sequence of Integers
description: Construct a program that checks whether a sequence of integers, entered one at a time, contains adjacent integers that are consecutive. The user enters -1 to indicate the end of the input.\nNote that integers which follow each other in order, without gaps, from smallest to largest are consecutive numbers. For example, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are consecutive numbers.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Finding Adjacent Numbers in Ascending Order in a Sequence of Numbers
description: Construct a program that checks whether a sequence of non-zero numbers, entered one at a time, contains adjacent numbers in ascending order. Numbers are said to be in ascending order when they are arranged from the smallest to the largest number. For example, 5, 9, 13, 17 and 21 are arranged in ascending order.\nNote that you need to think what value should the program use to indicate the end of the input.

The class Point has two data members, x and y that represent the point's integer coordinates in the two-dimensional space. For each class, write the class declaration, the constructor, the toString method, and a method to move (translate) the point, i.e., shift the point's location by the specified amount.\n\nThe class InheritancePointTester2 tests these classes and their methods.

*
**
***
****
*****

For example, when the number of rows in the inverted right triangle star pattern is 5, the program prints the following output:
*****
****
***
**
*

title: Counting the Number of Valid and Banned Product Codes (Case 1)
description: Suppose a hypothetical company uses codes to represent its various products. A product code includes, among other information, a character in the tenth position that represents the zone from which that product was made. Due to some reorganization, products from zone R are banned from being sold.\nConstruct a program that reads product codes from the user and counts the number of valid and banned codes entered. Make sure that the program handles all possible exceptions.\nThe program must ask the user for an input until the user enters STOP.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Counting the Number of Valid and Banned Product Codes (Case 2)
description: Suppose a hypothetical company uses codes to represent its various products. A product code includes, among other information, a character in the tenth position that represents the zone from which that product was made, and a four-digit integer representing the district in which it will be sold. This four-digit integer begins at the 4th character and extends to the 7th character in the input code (inclusive). Due to some reorganization, products from zone R are banned from being sold in districts with a designation of 2000 or higher.\nConstruct a program that reads product codes from the user and counts the number of valid and banned codes entered. Make sure that the program handles all possible exceptions.\nThe program must ask the user for an input until the user enters STOP.

title: Calculating the Employees Wage Based on the Hours That the Employee Has Worked and an Hourly Pay Rate
description: Construct a program for the payment department of a company to calculate the wage of an employee based on the number of hours that the employee has worked. If an employee works over 40 hours in a week, the payment amount should take into account the overtime hours. The overtime hours are paid at a rate one and a half times the regular pay rate.

title: Calculating the Wage of an Employee at the Customer Service Call Center
description: Construct a program for the payment department of a company to calculate the wage of an employee who works at the customer service call center. Like other employees in the company, the employees at the customer service call center are paid based on the hours that they work. If they work over 40 hours in a week, the payment amount should take into account the overtime hours. The overtime hours are paid at a rate one and a half times the regular pay rate.\nThe company's policy is to pay more to those employees at the customer service call center who work during weekends. Therefore, the minimum extra pay that the employees could receive for each day of work during weekends is $30. The extra pay increases to the maximum of $50 for the employees who have at least 5 days of work during weekends.

title: arrays2d.j_print_medals
description: PCEX Set of activities for arrays2d.j_print_medals
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Printing Table of Medal Winner Counts with Row Totals
description:
Assume that we have an array of countries that stores the names of the seven countries that participated in the Skating competitions at the Winter Olympic. We also have a 7x3 matrix that stores the number of medals that these seven countries won. This matrix looks like as follows:
{ {1, 0, 1 },
 { 1, 1, 0 },
 ...}
The first, second, and third numbers within a row i represent the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals won by the country that is at the index i of the array of countries.
Construct a program that takes this matrix and the array of countries, and prints a table of medal counts with row total that shows the number of Gold, Silver, Bronze, and Total medals for each of the countries that participated in the competition. The output table should look like as follows:
    Country    Gold  Silver  Bronze   Total
     Canada        1       0       1            2
        China        1       1       0            2
       ...
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Printing Table of Medal Winner Counts with Row and Column Totals
description:
Assume that we have an array of countries that stores the names of the seven countries that participated in the Skating competitions at the Winter Olympic. We also have a 7x3 matrix that stores the number of medals that these seven countries won. This matrix looks like as follows:
{ {1, 0, 1 },
 { 1, 1, 0 },
 ...}
The first, second, and third numbers within a row i represent the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals won by the country that is at the index i of the array of countries.
Construct a program that takes this matrix and the array of countries, and prints a table of medal counts with row and column totals. The column totals are the sum of the gold, silver, and bronze medals won in the competition. The output table should look like as follows:
      Country    Gold  Silver  Bronze   Total
         Canada        1       0       1          2
            China        1       1       0          2
           ...
Column Total      4       4       4
author: Mohammad Hassany

description: PCEX Set of activities for objects.classes.loan
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Loan (Case 1)
description:
Construct a class that represents a loan. This class should contain data representing the interest rate, loan amount, and the length of loan period (in years). The class should have constructors that permits a loan to be created when:
 - annual interest rate, length of loan period, and loan amount are specified\n - none of the properties of the loan are specified. In this, we create a loan with default values for the loan properties (3 % interest rate, 1-year loan period, and 1000 loan amount).
The other method of the this class should calculate the amount of monthly payments on the loan.

The LoanTester1 class instantiates an object from this class and invokes its method to determine the amount of monthly payments on the loan.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Loan (Case 2)
description:
Construct a class that represents a loan. This class should contain data representing the interest rate, loan amount, and the length of loan period (in years). The class should have constructors that permits a loan to be created when:
 - annual interest rate, length of loan period, and loan amount are specified
 - none of the properties of the loan are specified. In this, we create a loan with default values for the loan properties (3 % interest rate, 1-year loan period, and 1000 loan amount).
The other methods of the this class should calculate the amount of monthly payments on the loan as well as the total payment.

The LoanTester2 class instantiates an object from this class and invokes its method to determine the amount of monthly payments on the loan and the total payment.
author: Mohammad Hassany

The class should include methods to access the state of the TV and also methods to change the state of the TV (turn on/off, change channels). Assume that the valid channel range is from 1 to 120 (both inclusive). \n\nThe class TVTester1 instantiates two objects from this class and invokes the methods on those objects to turn on the TV and change the channel.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a TV (Case 2)
description: Construct a class that represents a TV. The class should contain data that represents the TV's state (power on or off, current volume level). The class should include methods to access the state of the TV and also methods to change the state of the TV (turn on/off, change volume level). Assume that the volume level is an integer and ranges from 1 to 7 (both inclusive). \n\nThe class TVTester2 instantiates two objects from this class and invokes the methods on those objects to turn on the TV and change the volume level.

title: The Class for Representing a Bank Account (Case 1)
description: Construct a class that represents a basic bank account. This class should contain data representing the name of the account’s owner, the account number, and the account’s current balance. The interest rate for the account is stored as a constant. The constructor of the class should accept three parameters that are used to initialize the instance (i.e., object) data when an object is instantiated from this class. The other methods of this class should perform various services on the account (making deposits, withdrawals, adding interest to the account). These methods should examine the data passed into them to make sure the requested transaction is valid.\n\nThe Transactions1 class creates some bank accounts and requests various services.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Bank Account (Case 2)
description:
Construct a class that represents a basic bank account. This class should contain data representing the name of the account’s owner, the account number, and the account’s current balance. The interest rate for the account is stored as a constant. The class should have constructors that permits an account to be opened when:
 - the account name, account number, and initial balance are specified
 - only the account name and the account number are specified. In this case, initial balance is assumed to be zero.
The other methods of this class should perform various services on the account (making deposits, withdrawals, adding interest to the account). These methods should examine the data passed into them to make sure the requested transaction is valid.

The Transactions2 class creates some bank accounts and requests various services.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Imprimir Tabla de Conteo de Medallas con Totales por Fila
description:
Supongamos que tenemos una matriz de 7x4 que almacena el número de medallas que siete países ganaron en las competencias de patinaje en los Juegos Olímpicos de Invierno. Esta matriz se ve como sigue:
[[ "Canada", 1, 0, 1 ],
 [ "China", 1, 1, 0 ],
 ...]
Cada fila de esta matriz corresponde a los conteos de medallas para el país en esa fila. Los segundo, tercero y cuarto números dentro de una fila representan el número de medallas de Oro, Plata y Bronce ganadas por el país correspondiente en esa fila.
Construya un programa que tome esta matriz e imprima una tabla de conteos de medallas con total por fila que muestre el número de medallas de Oro, Plata, Bronce y Total para cada uno de los países que participaron en la competencia. La tabla de salida debería verse como sigue:
    Pais    Oro  Plata  Bronce   Total
     Canada        1       0       1            2
        China        1       1       0            2
       ...
author: Jordan Ariel Barria Pineda

title: Imprimir Tabla de Conteo de Medallas con Totales por Fila y por Columna
description:
Supongamos que tenemos una matriz de 7x4 que almacena el número de medallas que siete países ganaron en las competencias de patinaje en los Juegos Olímpicos de Invierno. Esta matriz se ve como sigue:
[[ "Canada", 1, 0, 1 ],
 [ "China", 1, 1, 0 ],
 ...]
Cada fila de esta matriz corresponde a los conteos de medallas para el país en esa fila. El segundo, tercer y cuarto número dentro de una fila representan el número de medallas de Oro, Plata y Bronce ganadas por el país correspondiente en esa fila.
Construya un programa que tome esta matriz e imprima una tabla de conteos de medallas con totales de filas y columnas. Los totales de las columnas son la suma de las medallas de oro, plata y bronce ganadas en la competencia. La tabla de salida debería verse como sigue:
      Pais    Oro  Plata  Bronce   Total
         Canada        1       0       1          2
            China        1       1       0          2
           ...
Total de Columnas      4       4       4
author: Jordan Ariel Barria Pineda

title: Calculo del Indice de Masa Corporal (IMC)
description:
El IMC es una medida de la grasa corporal basada en la altura y el peso que se aplica a hombres y mujeres adultos. Las categorías de IMC son las siguientes:
Bajo peso = <18.5
Peso normal = 18.5–24.9
Sobrepeso = 25–29.9
Obesidad = IMC de 30 o más.
La fórmula del IMC es: IMC = (Peso en kilogramos / (Altura en pulgadas x Altura en pulgadas)).
Construya un programa que calcule el Índice de Masa Corporal (IMC) de acuerdo con esta fórmula.
author: Jordan Ariel Barria Pineda

title: Calculo y Redondeo del Indice de Masa Corporal (IMC) al Entero Mas Cercano.
description:
El IMC es una medida de grasa corporal basada en la altura y el peso que se aplica a hombres y mujeres adultos. Las categorías de IMC son las siguientes: 
Bajo peso = <18.5
Peso normal = 18.5–24.9
Sobrepeso = 25–29.9
Obesidad = IMC de 30 o más.
La fórmula del IMC es: IMC = (Peso en kilogramos / (Altura en metros x Altura en metros)).
Los resultados del IMC generalmente se muestran como enteros (valores sin puntos decimales). Construya un programa para redondear el resultado del IMC al entero más cercano.
author: Jordan Ariel Barria Pineda

title: Contando el Numero de Codigos de Producto Validos y Prohibidos (Caso 1)
description: Supongamos que una empresa hipotética utiliza códigos para representar sus diversos productos. Un código de producto incluye, entre otra información, un carácter en la décima posición que representa la zona de la que se fabricó ese producto. Debido a una reorganización, los productos de la zona R están prohibidos para la venta.\nConstruya un programa que lea códigos de productos del usuario y cuente el número de códigos válidos y prohibidos ingresados. Asegúrese de que el programa maneje todas las posibles excepciones.\nEl programa debe pedir al usuario una entrada hasta que el usuario ingrese STOP.

title: Contando el Numero de Codigos de Producto Validos y Prohibidos (Caso 2)
description: Supongamos que una empresa hipotética utiliza códigos para representar sus diversos productos. Un código de producto incluye, entre otra información, un carácter en la décima posición que representa la zona de la que se fabricó ese producto, y un número entero de cuatro dígitos que representa el distrito en el que se venderá. Este número entero de cuatro dígitos comienza en el cuarto carácter y se extiende hasta el séptimo carácter en el código de entrada (inclusive). Debido a una reorganización, los productos de la zona R están prohibidos para ser vendidos en distritos con una designación de 2000 o más.\nConstruya un programa que lea códigos de productos del usuario y cuente el número de códigos válidos y prohibidos ingresados. Asegúrese de que el programa maneje todas las posibles excepciones.\nEl programa debe pedir al usuario una entrada hasta que el usuario ingrese STOP.

Por ejemplo, si la cadena dada es "Esto es mi puntuación de prueba", el programa crea el siguiente diccionario:
e : ['esto', 'es']

description: Construir un programa que determine si es el momento de comprar un nuevo teléfono basado en las entradas que recibe del usuario. Se debe comprar un nuevo teléfono si el teléfono se rompe o si el teléfono tiene al menos 3 años.
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: Determinando Cuando Comprar un Nuevo Telefono (Caso 2)
description:
Construir un programa que determine si es el momento de comprar un nuevo teléfono basado en las entradas que recibe del usuario. Se debe comprar un nuevo teléfono en cualquiera de los siguientes casos:
el teléfono se rompe
la pantalla tiene un problema
el teléfono tiene el problema de apagado aleatorio
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: py_vending_machine_es

title: Maquina Expendedora Con Dolares y Monedas de Veinticinco
description: Supongamos que tenemos una máquina expendedora que da cambio. Un cliente selecciona un artículo para comprar e inserta un billete en la máquina expendedora. La máquina expendedora dispensa el artículo comprado y da cambio. Supondremos que todos los precios de los artículos son múltiplos de 25 centavos, y la máquina da todo el cambio en dólares y monedas de veinticinco. Construya un programa que calcule cuántos dólares y monedas de veinticinco devolver al cliente.
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: Maquina Expendedora Con Monedas de 25, 10, y 5 centavos
description: Supongamos que tenemos una máquina expendedora que da cambio. Un cliente selecciona un artículo para comprar e inserta un billete en la máquina expendedora. La máquina expendedora dispensa el artículo comprado y da cambio. Supondremos que todos los precios de los artículos son múltiplos de 5 centavos, y la máquina da todo el cambio en monedas de 25, 10 y 5 centavos. Construya un programa que calcule cuántas monedas de 25, 10, y 5 centavos debe devolver al cliente.
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: py_star_patterns_es
description: PCEX Set of activities for py_star_patterns_es
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: Imprimir un Patron de Estrellas en Forma de Triangulo Rectangulo
description:
Un patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo rectángulo contiene N asteriscos en la N-ésima fila. Construya un programa que reciba el número de filas en el patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo rectángulo y lo imprima. Por ejemplo, cuando el número de filas en el patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo rectángulo es 5, el programa imprime la siguiente salida:
*
**
***
****
*****
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

title: Imprimir un Patron de Estrellas en Forma de Triangulo Rectangulo Invertido
description:
Un patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo rectángulo invertido de N filas contiene N-i+1 asteriscos en la i-ésima fila. Construya un programa que reciba el número de filas en el patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo invertido y lo imprima. Por ejemplo, cuando el número de filas en el patrón de estrellas en forma de triángulo invertido es 5, el programa imprime la siguiente salida:
*****
****
***
**
*
author: Isaac Alpizar-Chacon

description: Construir un programa que encuentre el mayor divisor de un número positivo, excluyendo el número mismo. Por ejemplo, el mayor divisor de 24 es 12.

title: Advertir al Usuario sobre los Cambios en la Temperatura
description: Construir un programa que reciba la temperatura de hoy y de ayer y advierta al usuario cuando esté haciendo más frío, más calor o ninguno de los dos. Los valores de temperatura podrían tener una parte decimal.
author: Jordan Ariel Barria Pineda

title: Advertir al Usuario sobre los Cambios en la Temperatura y Humedad.
description: Construir un programa que reciba la temperatura y la humedad de hoy y de ayer y advierta al usuario cuando esté haciendo más frío o más calor o ninguno de los dos. Cuando esté haciendo más calor, el programa también debe advertir al usuario sobre los cambios en la humedad. En particular, debe advertir al usuario cuando la humedad de hoy es mayor, menor o no haya cambiado en comparación con la humedad de ayer. Tenga en cuenta que los valores de temperatura y humedad pueden tener una parte decimal.

title: objects_classes_account_llm
description: PCEX Set of activities for objects_classes_account_llm
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Bank Account (Case 1)
description: Construct a class that represents a basic bank account. This class should contain data representing the name of the account’s owner, the account number, and the account’s current balance; all of which could be accessed or changed only through the getter and setter methods. An instance of the class should be created by specifying three parameters that are used to initialize the instance (i.e., object) data. The other methods of this class should perform various services on the account (making deposits, withdrawals, adding interest to the account). These methods should examine the data passed into them to make sure the requested transaction is valid.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Bank Account (Case 2).
description: Construct a class that represents a basic bank account. This class should contain data representing the name of the account’s owner, the account number, and the account’s current balance; all of which could be accessed or changed only through the getter and setter methods. An instance of the class should be created by specifying three parameters that are used to initialize the instance (i.e., object) data. The other methods of this class should:\n - provide a one-line description of the account, and\n - perform various services on the account (making deposits, withdrawals, adding interest to the account). These methods should examine the data passed into them to make sure the requested transaction is valid.
author: Mohammad Hassany

description: PCEX Set of activities for objects_classes_point_llm
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Point in the Euclidean Plane (Case 1)
description: Construct a class that represents a point in the Euclidean plane. The class should contain data that represents the point’s integer coordinates (x,y). The point's coordinates could be accessed or changed only through the getter and setter methods. The class should also include a method to translate the point, i.e., shift the point's location by the specified amount.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: The Class for Representing a Point in the Euclidean Plane (Case 2).
description: Construct a class that represents a point in the Euclidean plane. The class should contain data that represents the point’s integer coordinates (x,y). The point's coordinates could be accessed or changed only through the getter and setter methods. The class should also include a method to calculate and return the point's distance from the origin (0,0).
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: py_char_dict_llm
description: PCEX Set of activities for py_char_dict_llm
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Creating a Dictionary of Character-Count Pairs
description:
Construct a program that has a function which receives a string from the user and creates a dictionary that maps each character in the given string to its frequency, that is, how many times that character appears in the given string.
For example, if the given string is "book", the program creates the following dictionary:
b : 1
o : 2
k : 1
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Creating a Dictionary of Character-Words Pairs.
description:
Construct a program that has a function which receives a string and creates a dictionary that maps each character to the list of distinct words in the given string that start with that character. The dictionary should be case insensitive.
For example, if the given string is "This is my test score", the program creates the following dictionary:
t : ['this', 'test']
i : ['is']
m : ['my']
s : ['score']
author: Mohammad Hassany

description: PCEX Set of activities for py_list_rotate_llm
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Left by One Position
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the left by 1 position so that the value at the front of the list goes to the back and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the list is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], the program will change it to [2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1].
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Left by Two Position
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the left by 2 position so that the value at the front of the list goes to the second last position, the second value of the list goes to the back, and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the list is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], the program will change it to [3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2].
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Right by One Position.
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the right by one position so that the value that is currently at the end of the list is moved to the front, shifting the remaining values to the right. For example, if the list is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], the program will change it to [6, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5].
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Right by Two Position.
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the right by 2 position so that the value that is currently at the end of the list is moved to the second position, the second last value of the list is moved to the front of the list, and the remaining values are shifted to the right. For example, if the list is [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6], the program will change it to [5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 4].
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Finding Adjacent Duplicates in a Sequence of Numbers

title: Finding Adjacent Consecutive Numbers in a Sequence of Integers.
description: Construct a program that checks whether a sequence of integers, entered one at a time, contains adjacent integers that are consecutive. The user enters -1 to indicate the end of the input.\nNote that integers which follow each other in order, without gaps, from smallest to largest are consecutive numbers. For example, 12, 13, 14 and 15 are consecutive numbers.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Finding Adjacent Numbers in Ascending Order in a Sequence of Numbers.

Numbers are said to be in ascending order when they are arranged from the smallest to the largest number. For example, 5, 9, 13, 17 and 21 are arranged in ascending order.\nNote that you need to think what value should the program use to indicate the end of the input.

description: Construct a program for the payment department of a company to calculate the wage of an employee based on the number of hours that the employee has worked. If an employee works over 40 hours in a week, the payment amount should take into account the overtime hours. The overtime hours are paid at a rate one and a half times the regular pay rate.

title: Calculating the Wage of an Employee at the Customer Service Call Center.
description: Construct a program for the payment department of a company to calculate the wage of an employee who works at the customer service call center. Like other employees in the company, the employees at the customer service call center are paid based on the hours that they work. If they work over 40 hours in a week, the payment amount should take into account the overtime hours. The overtime hours are paid at a rate one and a half times the regular pay rate.\nThe company's policy is to pay more to those employees at the customer service call center who work during weekends. Therefore, the minimum extra pay that the employees could receive for each day of work during weekends is $30. The extra pay increases to the maximum of $50 for the employees who have at least 5 days of work during weekends.

title: Calculating Body Mass Index (BMI)
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows:
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
Construct a program that calculates the Body Mass Index (BMI) according to this formula.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating and Rounding Up Body Mass Index (BMI) To the Nearest Integer.
description:

Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
 BMI results are usually displayed as integers (values without decimal points). Construct a program to round the BMI result to the nearest integer.

title: Calculating the Wage of an Employee at the Customer Service Call Center
description: Construct a program for the payment department of a company to calculate the wage of an employee who works at the customer service call center. Like other employees in the company, the employees at the customer service call center are paid based on the hours that they work. If they work over 40 hours in a week, the payment amount should take into account the overtime hours. The overtime hours are paid at a rate one and a half times the regular pay rate.\nThe company's policy is to pay more to those employees at the customer service call center who work during weekends. Therefore, the minimum extra pay that the employees could receive for each day of work during weekends is $30. The extra pay increases to the maximum of $50 for the employees who have at least 5 days of work during weekends.

description: Construct a program by using Queue structure to solve a Josephus problem. Josephus problem is a counting-out game. N people are in a circle, labeled as 1, 2, 3, … ,n. Given a skip number k, counting from the person labeled as 1, in every round, after k number of people are skipped, the next person will be counted out of the circle. b : 1
o : 2
k : 1

title: Creating a Dictionary of Character-Words Pairs
description:

For example, if the given string is "This is my test score", the program creates the following dictionary:
t : ['this', 'test']
i : ['is']
m : ['my']
s : ['score']

title: arithmetic.bmi_calculator
description: PCEX Set of activities for arithmetic.bmi_calculator
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating Body Mass Index (BMI)
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows:
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
Construct a program that calculates the Body Mass Index (BMI) according to this formula.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating and Rounding Up Body Mass Index (BMI) To the Nearest Integer
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows: 
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
 BMI results are usually displayed as integers (values without decimal points). Construct a program to round the BMI result to the nearest integer.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Left by One Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the left by 1 position so that the value at the front of the array goes to the back and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 1}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Left by Two Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the left by 2 position so that the value at the front of the array goes to the second last position, the second value of the array goes to the back, and the order of the other values stays the same. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {3, 4, 5, 6, 1, 2}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the Array Values to the Right by One Position
description: Construct a program that has a method that receives an array of values and returns the array rotated to the right by one position so that the value that is currently at the end of the array is moved to the front, shifting the remaining values to the right. For example, if the array is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {6, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Rotating the List Values to the Right by Two Position
description: Construct a program that has a function that receives a list of values and returns the list rotated to the right by 2 position so that the value that is currently at the end of the list is moved to the second position, the second last value of the list is moved to the front of the list, and the remaining values are shifted to the right. For example, if the list is {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6}, the program will change it to {5, 6, 1, 2, 3, 4}.

If the key is not found, -1 is returned.

title: Recursive Binary Search
description: Construct a function that uses recursive binary search to find if a specific value is in a list (known as a "key"). Recall: Binary search uses the "Divide and Conquer" strategy. Given a list of ordered integers, the key is searched by dividing the data list in half and only searching in the half that contains the key, and repeating the process until the key is found and the index of the key is returned. If the key is not found, -1 is returned.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Tree traversal.
description: The tree can be traversed by deciding on a sequence to visit each node. There are three traversal algorithms: in-order traversal, pre-order traversal and post-order traversal. In-order traversal visits the nodes from the left, the root node and the right Pre-order traversal visits the nodes from the root node, the left and the right Post-order traversal visits the nodes from the left, the right and the root node. In this example, we construct an in-order traversal algorithm.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Tree traversal.
description: The tree can be traversed by deciding on a sequence to visit each node. There are three traversal algorithms: in-order traversal, pre-order traversal and post-order traversal. In-order traversal visits the nodes from the left, the root node and the right Pre-order traversal visits the nodes from the root node, the left and the right Post-order traversal visits the nodes from the left, the right and the root node. In this challenge, we construct an post-order traversal algorithm.

title: Calculating Body Mass Index (BMI)
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows:
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
Construct a program that calculates the Body Mass Index (BMI) according to this formula.
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Calculating and Rounding Up Body Mass Index (BMI) To the Nearest Integer
description:
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women. BMI Categories are as follows: 
Underweight = <18.5
Normal weight = 18.5–24.9
Overweight = 25–29.9
Obesity = BMI of 30 or greater.
English BMI Formula (Imperial) is: BMI = (Weight in Pounds / (Height in inches x Height in inches)) x 703.
 BMI results are usually displayed as integers (values without decimal points). Construct a program to round the BMI result to the nearest integer.

author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Printing Table of Medal Counts with Row Totals
description:
Assume that we have a 7x4 matrix that stores the number of medals that seven countries won in the skating competitions at the Winter Olympic. This matrix looks like as follows:
[[ "Canada", 1, 0, 1 ],
 [ "China", 1, 1, 0 ],
 ...]
Each row of this matrix corresponds to the medal counts for the country in that row. The second, third, and fourth numbers within a row represent the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals won by the corresponding country in that row.
Construct a program that takes this matrix and prints a table of medal counts with row total that shows the number of Gold, Silver, Bronze, and Total medals for each of the countries who participated in the competition. The output table should look like as follows:
    Country    Gold  Silver  Bronze   Total
     Canada        1       0       1            2
        China        1       1       0            2
       ...
author: Mohammad Hassany

title: Printing Table of Medal Winner Counts with Row and Column Totals
description:
Assume that we have a 7x4 matrix that stores the number of medals that seven countries won in the skating competitions at the Winter Olympic. This matrix looks like as follows:
[[ "Canada", 1, 0, 1 ],
 [ "China", 1, 1, 0 ],
 ...]
Each row of this matrix corresponds to the medal counts for the country in that row. The second, third, and fourth numbers within a row represent the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals won by the corresponding country in that row.
Construct a program that takes this matrix and prints a table of medal counts with row and column totals. The column totals are the sum of the gold, silver, and bronze medals won in the competition. The output table should look like as follows:
      Country    Gold  Silver  Bronze   Total
         Canada        1       0       1          2
            China        1       1       0          2
           ...
Column Total      4       4       4
author: Mohammad Hassany
